description: After the city of Manchester (England), once an important centre for the manufacture of cotton textile goods.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A type of cotton fabric, or a piece of clothing made from such fabric. [16thâ€“18th c.]
examples: Betsy, as Muslin, had a very showy striped pink and white Manchester, pink shoes, red Ribbons in abundance and a short Apron.

entries.meaning: (Australia, New Zealand, uncountable) Household linen. [from 20th c.]
